item.title: clinton makes first visit to post-mubarak egypt
item.description: secretary of state hillary clinton tuesday began the highest-level visit to egypt by a u.s. official since an uprising toppled president hosni mubarak, for decades a close ally of washington.

item.title: del potro says he will make it to french open
item.description: former u.s. open champion juan martin del potro will play at the french open starting this weekend, the argentine said on tuesday.

item.title: eu to seek bank commitment to hold greek debt: sources
item.description: the main option under consideration for greece now is a voluntary deal by investors to maintain their greek bond holdings over the period of another eu/imf program from 2011 to 2014, euro zone sources said.

item.title: thousands flee violence in sudan's abyei, u.n. says
item.description: more than 15,000 people have fled sudan's abyei region to the south after the northern army seized the disputed area and parts of the main town were burned and looted, united nations officials said tuesday.

item.title: german minister says nuclear u-turn "not rational": report
item.description: germany's economy minister told a closed meeting of business leaders that berlin's sudden u-turn on nuclear power was based on electoral politics and was 'not rational', a newspaper reported on thursday.

item.title: amex in venture with french luxury shopping site

item.description: by end of year, virgin poised to add multimedia elements such as social gaming, geolocation services.

item.description: syria's president says he expects the government to lift the country's decades-old emergency laws next week.

item.description: a day after commissioner bud selig moved to take control of the los angeles dodgers, a raft of questions ' including who would run the club ' remain unanswered.

item.title: tennessee investigator makes plea for help in bobo case

item.description: erratic as jake delhomme was, cleveland's offense flowed best with him under center. still, it was worthwhile for coaches to let colt mccoy learn the ropes.

item.description: reader rabbit has been teaching kids with his entertaining antics for 25 years, and now he is doing it on the nintendo wii.

item.description: japanese officials declared the accident at the fukushima daiichi nuclear power plant a level 7 emergency on tuesday, putting it on par with the accident at chernobyl in 1986.

item.description: global food prices fell slightly in may, but they will remain "at stubbornly high levels" for months to come, a u.n. agency said tuesday.

item.description: an alliance of southeastern public interest groups on wednesday asked the nuclear regulatory commission to suspend the fast-track approval process for the new westinghouse ap1000 reactor.

item.title: u.s. weather extremes show "new normal" climate

item.description: the property developers vincent and robert tchenguiz were among those arrested over their ties to the icelandic bank kaupthing, which collapsed in 2008.

item.title: panasonic sees tough year as quake aftermath hampers
item.description: japan's panasonic corp will have an extremely tough year, with the effects of the devastating march earthquake continuing to hamper sales through september, the head of the electronics giant said on friday.

item.title: work halted on new york judges' luxury flats
item.description: new york's financial woes have forced the state's court of appeals to halt the $23-million renovation of a former catholic school into luxury apartments for judges.

item.title: "autism epidemic" challenged by uk research
item.description: a national uk survey out monday found no traces of an "autism epidemic," despite earlier reports that the developmental disorder has been rising quickly in recent decades.

item.title: will i be alive tomorrow, asks japanese woman on internet
item.description: thousands of people in tech-savvy japan swamped the internet in the hours after a devastating earthquake and tsunami to tell loved ones they were safe, but social networking sites were also flooded with worries about an explosion at a nuclear plant.

item.title: aig working on investing cash, may bid on bonds

item.description: manufacturers in europe and china tapped the brakes this month and price pressures eased as tighter policy measures to control inflation began to bite, purchasing managers' indexes showed on monday.

item.description: jon lester remains at a loss when asked to explain all his wins against the baltimore orioles.

item.description: sprint nextel is urging government officials to block atamp;t inc.'s planned acquisition of t-mobile.

item.description: after an afternoon of upsets and nailbiters, high seeds like connecticut, brigham young and wisconsin won easily.

item.title: two fukushima workers may have exceeded radiation limit

item.description: gary woodland, a pure athlete who only started serious golf competition eight years ago, figured out quickly that hitting the ball from here to the moon was not going to help him win tournaments.

item.description: celgene corp's cancer drug, revlimid, significantly extended the lives of patients with multiple myeloma who took the drug as a maintenance therapy following a stem cell transplant.

item.description: the hundreds of illegal immigrants recently fired from fast-growing burrito chain chipotle mexican grill inc had a pretty good run when it came to job security.

item.title: senate panel slams goldman in scathing crisis report
item.description: in the most damning official u.s. report yet produced on wall street's role in the financial crisis, a senate panel accused powerhouse goldman sachs of misleading clients and manipulating markets, while also condemning greed, weak regulation and conflicts of interest throughout the financial system.

item.title: kevin long's winding road
item.description: part of kevin long's job as the hitting coach for the yankees is to build trust, to get his players to buy what he is selling. he has been far more successful doing that than he was at an off-season job in the minors, when he tried to sell yugos in phoenix.
